body.directions: Listen to the audio in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following is the possessive adjective format of the word in the audio to show possession?
body.answer: Audio for 我的 wǒde
options: Audio for 我是 wǒshì
Audio for 你是 nǐshì
Audio for 你的 nǐde
body.correct: You got it! The word “我 wǒ” means “I,” followed by the possessive adjective particle ”的 de,” so it becomes “my/mine.”
body.incorrect: Very close. Would you like to listen again? Pay attention to the first syllable and the second part, which is the possessive adjective “的 de.”

body.quiz: Which of the following words in characters matches the audio you’ve heard?
body.correct: You nailed it! The audio can correspond to 他的— his.
body.incorrect: Very close! Please listen again and think about what pronoun the sound “tā” can correspond to. You can refer to the earlier lesson “Rooted in Place” for more information.

body.textVersion: Audio for 他的电话是多少？ Tāde diànhuà shì duōshǎo?

body.quiz: What is a good response to the question in the audio?
body.answer: 她的电话是 794-3846. tā de diàn huà shì qī jiǔ sì sān bā sì liù
options: 我的电话是 794-3846. Wǒ de diàn huà shì qī jiǔ sì sǎn bā sì liù.
他住在佛罗里达州。 Tā zhùzài Fúluólǐdá zhōu.
她叫 Lisa. Tā jiào Lisa.
body.correct: What an excellent job catching the correct audio response! You’ve got both the numbers and pronouns right. Yay!
body.incorrect: Not quite… please listen to the question again. Remember that sometimes we say 电话 diànhuà instead of 电话号码 diànhuà màomǎ for the word “phone number.”
